by unpluggin and plugging it... gnome has detected the HD and mounted it on /media/usbdisk
the kernel rescanned it when you plugged it in again
also, 5% is reserved for root's use
you can reduce that percentage with 'tune2fs'
just let hotplug/g-v-m do it for you
where you here when i talked about a bug/error i found on the array 5 of hoary?

it happens that i installed ubuntu hoary in a pc with a d-link wireless card. The installation procedure detected my wifi card and used it in the installation, but after rebooting, the system did not detect the wifi card. I looked around te problem, and i discovered that the installation didnt ut the firmware file in the /lib/hotplug/firmware directory
do you know how to make hotplug run on boot before the external hd mounting?
i have added it to fstab
suspend-to-disk should work everywhere, suspend-to-ram varies by hardware
